nodes.text: Incubate the MTP well surface with 100 μL of 1% (w/v) KOH in DIW for 10 min at 37°C and wash five times with 300 μL DIW per well).
Mix EDC-activated anti-HFA capture Ab (8 µg mL-1) with 1% (v/v) APTES in a ratio of 1:1 (v/v).
Incubate each of the desired wells of 96-well MTP with 100 μL of the freshly prepared anti-HFA capture Ab solution, with a final concentration of 4 µg mL-1 in 0.5% APTES, for 30 min at 37°C.
Wash five times with 300 μL of 0.1M PBS, pH 7.4.
Block the MTP wells by incubating with 300 μL of 1% (w/v) BSA for 30 min a 37°C and wash with 300 μL of 0.1M PBS, pH 7.4 five times.

Dispense sequentially 100 µL of biotinylated anti-HFA detection Ab (0.17 µg mL-1) pre-conjugated to SA-HRP and 100 µL of HFA (varying concentrations; 0.1-243 ng mL-1) to the Ab-bound and BSA-blocked MTP wells.
Wash the resulting sandwich immune complex-bound MTP with 300 µL of 0.1M PBS, pH 7.4 five times to remove the non-specifically substances and excess IA reagents.
Add 100 µL of the TMB-H2O2 mixture to each MTP well and incubate at RT for 14 min to allow the enzymatic reaction to develop color
Stop the enzymatic reaction by adding 50 µL of 2N H2SO4 to each MTP well.
Record the absorbance at a primary wavelength of 450 nm taking 540 nm as the reference wavelength in a Tecan Infinite M200 Pro microplate reader.
